newsitem.title: GERMANY: Hoechst shares jump after Clariant deal.
newsitem.headline: Hoechst shares jump after Clariant deal.

text.p: Shares in German chemicals and drugs group Hoechst AG jumped to record highs on Tuesday after the firm announced it would merge its speciality chemicals business with Swiss group Clariant AG.

Hoechst shares raced ahead to a record high of 70.90 marks, from 69.15 marks, when the shares were suspended from both IBIS and floor trade. The share than settled back to trade up 1.23 marks, almost two percent, at 70.00 marks in IBIS dealings by 1145 GMT.
In bourse trade the stock traded up 1.72 marks at 70.40 marks, a bourse record.
Meanwhile the rest of the market was also firmer, with the DAX index of leading shares up 1.12 percent at 2,889.24 points.
Shares in Clariant were suspended around 1104 GMT and were last traded at 459 Swiss france, up 11 francs from Monday's close.
